content: space v st in each of the next 5 v st s make a corner in chain-2 space v st in each of the next 5 v st s v st chain 1 double_crochet in last chain 1 space turn round 5 thru 20- repeat round 4 with your v stitches increasing by 4 in each round 2 on each side ex round 5 would be ch4 vst in first chain 1 space vst in each of the next 7 v st s and so on round 21- chain 4 double_crochet in first chain 1 space v st in each v st make a corner in chain-2 space v st in each v st up to the last chain-1 space v st in last chain-1 space turn round 22- chain 4 v st in first v st v st in each v st make a corner in chain-2 space v st in each v st except the last one v st chain 1 double_crochet in last v st turn round 23- repeat round 21 round 24- repeat round 22 round 25- repeat round 21 round 26- repeat round 22 omitting the chain-2 space from your corner grouping *****important****** before you start round 27 which will be your edging make sure you have an even number of chain-1 spaces or your edging will not work out correctly if you have done the 26 rounds you should have 98 chain-1 spaces 1 chain-1 space at the beginning of the round 96 chain-1 spaces in your v stitches and 1 chain-1 space at the end of the round round 27- chain 1 single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in first chain-1 space make a picot double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in next chain 1 space * single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in v st make a picot double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in next v st repeat from * 22 times this should put you at the point of the shawl where your 2 v stitches would usually be separated by a chain-2 space which you omitted in round 26 keep going with the same repeat 24 times you should have 2 chain-1 spaces left double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in next chain-1 space make a picot double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in last chain-1 space continue now around the base edge working around the posts of each st * single_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet in the same space as your last single_crochet double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet around the next post repeat from * down the base edge finishing off with a double_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet in the same space that you started round 26 optional bead round place 49 beads on your crochet thread single_crochet in each stitch single_crochet in the first chain of the picot single_crochet in top of picot but right before finishing the stitch slide a bead up thread over and finish the stitch single_crochet in the last chain of the picot this is where you slip stitched to make the picot continue in this manner until your last picot finish off with a single_crochet in
